newsitem.title: USA: IBM unveils new voice-recognition software.
newsitem.headline: IBM unveils new voice-recognition software.

text.p: International Business Machines Corp on Tuesday unveiled an expansion of its family of voice-recognition software products.
IBM said its Simply Speaking Gold is an enhanced version of its VoiceType Simply Speaking dictation software.
Voice-recognition technology allows people to use their voices to do a tasks on their computers that would normally be accomplished through keyboard and mouse input.
Simply Speaking Gold is priced at $99.
IBM plans to ship the software in Spanish, French, German, Italian, and UK English in July.
IBM said its VoiceType Simply Speaking product would now be priced at $49.95.
It said it also unveiled ViaVoice, a general-purpose continuous-speech dictation product that recognizes the spoken word. ViaVoice is to be available in August at a price of $199.
